**Summary:**

Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) is a type of software that helps businesses manage their processes in real time. It collects and shares data from different departments like manufacturing, sales, and accounting. ERP systems can be local or cloud-based, with cloud systems becoming more popular. They provide a unified view of the business, tracking resources and commitments. According to Gartner, the global ERP market is worth $35 billion (2021). Although initially for large companies, smaller businesses are now also using ERP. It enhances efficiency by integrating different systems and reducing errors.
title: Enterprise resource planning
